climbs.name: Swilderness Permit
climbs.fa: Paul Van Betten, Richard Harrison, Sal Mamusia

content.description: Route begins behind a bush at the bottom of the face (crag faces east).

climbs.name: Swilderness Experience
climbs.fa: Paul Van Betten, Richard Harrison, Shelby Shelton

content.description: Begin about a dozen feet to the right of mexican secret agent man

climbs.name: Spanky
climbs.fa: S. Shelton, Paul Van Betten, Sal Mamusia, R. Harrison

content.description: Start about a dozen feet to the right of payless cashaways. There is a big scoop on the wall, begin climbing to the right of that.
16 feet to the right of 'swilderness permit' top rope.
Route begins on the north facing side. This routes shares the same beginning as Jack Officers, Ranch Hands, Blood Stains. Head up to a block then follow the left veering crack.

climbs.name: Ranch Hands
climbs.fa: Paul Van Betten, Richard Harrison, Sal Mamusia, Bob Conz

content.description: climb beginning of roman hands and set up a belay at the bottom of the block. climb right of the block.

climbs.name: Payless Cashaways
climbs.fa: S. Shelton, Paul Van Betten, Sal Mamusia, R. Harrison

content.description: Furthermost route on the left. There is a roof over on the left, route starts on right side of the roof.
content.protection: 5 Bolts. *books say there is an anchor, but recently climbed 1/2019 there no anchor found. see comment section

content.description: About have a dozen feet to the right of spanky, you will see a modestly sized right-flake, begin there.

climbs.name: Blood Stains
climbs.fa: Paul Van Betten, Richard Harrison, Sal Mamusia

content.description: Beginning is shared with roman hands route, then move off to the right. Up a crack to overhanging section. Once over that then climb arete to another overhanging section. Once over that then to the left is shared anchor (ranch hands anchor).
content.protection: how many bolts? ... only so many bolts...

climbs.name: Jack Officers
climbs.fa: Paul Van Betten, Richard Harrison, Sal Mamusia

content.description: climb the beginning of roman hands and set up a belay at the block. climb left of the block.

This is as much beta as you would get in the ol Book for RR, Yet disclaiming also what books often say, which is climb at your own risk and cannot confirm status every bolt or anchor, etc.

 Most of the climbs on Ranch Hands Crag face east, which means sun...likely in the shade by mid afternoon

 Routes range from 35' to 75' with the exception of roman hands which is 155'.
